de.esoco.lib.mapping

Class GenericMethodDatatypeMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.mapping.GenericMethodDatatypeMapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MethodDatatypeMapper

    public abstract class GenericMethodDatatypeMapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements MethodDatatypeMapper

    Generic implementation of the MethodDatatypeMapper interface that is based on a mapping table of datatype classes. It is abstract because the mapping of values must be implemented by subclasses. The mapping methods will be invoked through reflection. So, to provide a certain mapping a subclass needs to do the following:

    1. Register the supported datatype classes with one of the methods addMapping() or addOneWayMapping(), preferrably in the constructor
    2. For each registered datatype, provide two methods (only one for one-way mappings) for the datatype mappings with a name and signature as described in the comment of the mapValue() method

    This implementation also takes into account datatype inheritance hierarchies. That means that a mapping will be detected even if the classes added with the addMapping() method are not the same as the types that are used as the runtime arguments to the MethodDatatypeMapper methods. The implementation will then search the superclasses of the argument types until it finds a mapping for one of these classes. Therefore it would be possible to provide a default mapping handler by adding a mapping for class Object and providing a mapObject() method.

    See Also:
    mapValue(Object, Method, Object)

      • appliesTo

        public boolean appliesTo(java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                         java.lang.Class<?> rDatatype)
        Description copied from interface: MethodDatatypeMapper
        Checks if this mapper applies to a particular datatype. This method must return TRUE for all datatypes that are covered by this mapper.
        Specified by:
        appliesTo in interface MethodDatatypeMapper
        Parameters:
        rMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rDatatype - The datatype to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if this mapper should be used to map parameters of the given type
        See Also:
        MethodDatatypeMapper.appliesTo(Method, Class)

      • mapValue

        public java.lang.Object mapValue(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                 java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                                 java.lang.Object rValue)
        Implements a dispatcher that invokes a public method of a subclass to convert the value. The signature of the method that will be invoked must be of the following type: 
                   public [MappedType] map[OriginalTypeName](Object, Method, [OriginalType])

        Example: the method for the mapping from a.b.OldType to x.y.NewType would be

        public x.y.NewType mapOldType(Object rTarget, Method rMethod, a.b.OldType)

        The return value of the method may also be of another type, e.g. if the implementation distinguishes between different methods that map to the same datatype in the source but different ones in the target implementations.

        The method may also be static, e.g. if the application needs to invoke the mapping methods directly and doesn't want to create a separate instance.

        Specified by:
        mapValue in interface MethodDatatypeMapper
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object of the method call
        rMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rValue - The value to map the datatype of
        Returns:
        The converted value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the target method for the dispatching could not be found
        See Also:
        MethodDatatypeMapper.mapValue(Object, Method, Object)

      • addMapping

        protected final void addMapping(java.lang.Class<?> rFirst,
                                java.lang.Class<?> rSecond)
        Adds a two-way mapping to the internal mapping table.
        Parameters:
        rFirst - The first datatype to map
        rSecond - The second datatype to map

      • addOneWayMapping

        protected final void addOneWayMapping(java.lang.Class<?> rSource,
                                      java.lang.Class<?> rTarget)
        Adds a one-way mapping to the internal mapping table. This will only map the source datatype to the target datatype, but not vice versa.
        Parameters:
        rSource - The source datatype
        rTarget - The target datatype
